sentences.en: Beneath this romanticism, however , a stark reality.
sentences.cn: 在这种良好的精神背后是残酷的现实.

sentences.en: Dun's early literary career underwent the change from neo - romanticism back to naturalism.
sentences.cn: 茅盾早期的文学选择有过从“新浪漫主义”退回“自然主义”的变化.
他比较倾向于浪漫主义.
他从小就受到浪漫主义的熏陶.

sentences.en: Her determined romanticism was worrying me.
sentences.cn: 她坚定的浪漫主义情怀让我感到担忧。

sentences.en: His poetry tended towards a dreamy romanticism.
sentences.cn: 他的诗歌带有一种梦幻般的浪漫色彩。

sentences.en: In fact, realism and romanticism were both expressions of their time.
sentences.cn: 其实现实主义和浪漫主义都是他们那个时代的表现.

sentences.en: Nathaniel Hawthorne ( 1804 - 1864 ) and Emily Bronte ( 1818 - 1848 ), are both full of romanticism.
sentences.cn: 纳撒尼尔·霍桑 ( 1804-1864 ) 与艾米莉·勃朗特 ( 1818-1848 ) 这两位作家都具有浪漫主义气质.

sentences.en: The beauty of nature and human feelings were important ideas in romanticism.
sentences.cn: 崇尚自然美和人的感受是浪漫主义的主要思想.

sentences.en: The duality of classicism and romanticism - a peculiarity of Mendelssohn's piano music.
sentences.cn: 门德尔松钢琴音乐风格特性表现之 二—— 音乐语言的明晰性.

sentences.en: The Ninth Symphony , an work of his seniority, initiated romanticism in music.
sentences.cn: 《第九交响曲》是他晚年的惊世之作, 开创了浪漫主义音乐的先河.

sentences.en: The romanticism of the bar enriches the night life of Shanghai.
sentences.cn: 有浪漫的情怀,撩动夜的上海.

sentences.en: This kind of romanticism is everywhere in Buchan's books.
sentences.cn: 这种浪漫思想在巴肯的书中俯拾皆是.

sentences.en: This period was the hightide of Romanticism.
sentences.cn: 这是浪漫主义的颠峰时期.

sentences.en: This phenomenon was severely criticized by humanism and romanticism.
sentences.cn: 这种情形受到了人文主义、浪漫主义的激烈批评.

words.tran_cn: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
浪漫主义者；浪漫主义艺术家
（英）有浪漫主义思想；（英）以浪漫方式进行（等于romanticize）

trans.tran_cn: 浪漫的思想感情，浪漫主义，传奇小说体裁，传奇性
trans.tran_en: a way of writing or painting that was popular in the late 18th and early 19th century, in which feelings, imagination, and wild natural beauty were considered more important than anything else
